column4: Hello everyone ! I just did a bigmistake : i added noatime to my fstab options and now my root partitions is mounted as read only ! how can i fix this ?
thought so, that's what you get for reading slashdot.  Remove the data=writeback (using a liveCD) and you'll be good.
: and if i have no cd drive ? there is no other solution ?
get yourself a usb key and DSL, set it up and boot from that.
by the way do you have any tips to improve battery life that on't involve breaking the system ?
most of the time you could just remount / read only, but data=writeback won't allow remounting (with the -o remount option)
not really, just the usual stuff (frequency stepping, turning down the brightness, and you can make syslog not flush the cache)
okay thanks for the tip. And could you explain why it makes it read only ? i did read the mount manpage before turning on the option...

I didn't look into it really, I guess that option isn't supported by the ubuntu kernel.  If you read kernel trap, you can guess they're using the most recent kernel and probably some non-standard patches.
Another big thank you for your time :) by the way how many people got owned by that stupid fstab trick ? x)
so far I know of 2 (and I always have a liveCD around for when I screw up)
